page.title: 07Fine Fare Bus
page.content: The bus leaves every Tuesday at 10.10am, arriving Inverness around 11am.{Shoppers travel free}but are required to spend a{minimum of Â£5}in the Superstore. Highland Omnibuses are paid by the store for transporting the people. There are normally between 30 and 40 people from Grantown using the bus. These figures rise before Christmas and during the school holidays. Our survey showed{more people {disapproved of this bus than approved. They thought that trade in Grantown shops would suffer, leading to some closing, leaving people who could not travel worse off than before. Those who did approve found it cheaper than Fine Fare in Grantown and enjoyed the trip to Inverness shops, especially pensioners who found they could save money on their groceries.
